author: mklement0
body:
<sup>Follow-up from #6495.</sup>

Note that `Get-Help` implicitly targets the provider underlying the current location and quietly falls back to provider-independent help if provider-specific help isn't available.

This implicit fallback is fine, but any attempts to _explicitly_ target a provider should result in errors - or at least  a warning - if the provider cannot be identified or the provider-specific help is not available.

Note that if #6494 gets implemented it should exhibit analogous behavior.

Steps to reproduce (run on Windows, with help files installed)
------------------

```powershell
# Try to obtain the filesystem-specific Get-Item help topic by passing a filesystem-provider
# path to -Path (on Windows)
(Get-Help Get-Item -Path C:\).Synopsis

# Pass an invalid path from which the target provider cannot be inferred.
(Get-Help Get-Item -Path DefinitelyNoSuchDrive:OrPath).Synopsis

# Currently only verifiable on Windows PowerShell:
# Pass a syntactically valid path based on existing drive that happens not to refer to an existing item.
Set-Location HKLM:; (Get-Help Get-Item -Path C:\NoSuchDir).Synopsis
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

1st command:

Given that as of  PowerShell Core v6.0.2, where provider-specific help is not yet available:
An error message or warning indicating that provider-specific help (for the FileSystem provider, the provider implied by the `C:\` path argument) 

2nd command:

An error message or warning indicating that the target provider could not be inferred from the specified path.

3rd command:

Two options:

An error message or warning indicating that the target provider could not be inferred from the specified path, because it doesn't refer to an existing item.

OR 

```
Gets files or folders.
```

That is, if the *drive* that the path refers to exists, then the provider can be inferred even if the rest of the path doesn't exist.

Actual behavior:
---------------

```none
Gets the item at the specified location.
Gets the item at the specified location.
Gets the item at the specified location.
```

That is, the _provider-independent_ help was quietly reverted to in all cases.

Environment data
----------------

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.0.2 on macOS 10.13.3
PowerShell Core v6.0.2 on Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
PowerShell Core v6.0.2 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; v10.0.15063)
Windows PowerShell v5.1.15063.674 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; v10.0.15063)
```
title: Get-Help -Path quietly ignores invalid arguments / unavailability of provider-specific help
